description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dv689","text":"Long-read Structural Variation (SV) calling remains a challenging but highly accurate way to identify complex genomic alterations. Here, we present Sniffles2, which is faster and more accurate than state-of-the-art SV caller across different coverages, sequencing technologies, and SV types. Furthermore, Sniffles2 solves the problem of family- to population-level SV calling to produce fully genotyped VCF files by introducing a gVCF file concept. Across 11 probands, we accurately identified causative SVs around MECP2, including highly complex alleles with three overlapping SVs. Sniffles2 also enables the detection of mosaic SVs in bulk long-read data. As a result, we successfully identified multiple mosaic SVs across a multiple system atrophy patient brain. The identified SV showed a remarkable diversity within the cingulate cortex, impacting both genes  involved in neuron function and repetitive elements. In summary, we demonstrate the utility and versatility of Sniffles2 to identify SVs from the mosaic to population levels.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccah0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ea4u","text":"Sniffles single sample SV calling","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7oj8m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"20rue","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"Sniffles call","description":"","guid":"B5EC8AA65EF711EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"sniffles --input mapped_input.bam --vcf output.vcf.gz --snf output.snf","os_name":"","os_version":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9c5pc","text":"Sniffles population SV calling","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mvu3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"52ab5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"Sniffles population","description":"","guid":"E493CE555EF711EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"sniffles --input sample1.bam --vcf sample1.vcf.gz --snf sample1.snf

sniffles --input sample2.bam --vcf sample2.vcf.gz --snf sample2.snf

sniffles --input sampleN.bam --vcf sampleN.vcf.gz --snf sampleN.snf

sniffles --input sample1.snf sample2.snf sampleN.snf --vcf multisample.vcf.gz","os_name":"","os_version":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63j6o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14n2a","text":"HG002 SV calling for the following technologies and coverage:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"oms1","text":"Oxford Nanopore Technologies: 5x, 10x, 20x, 30x and 50x","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmlhm","text":"PacBio HiFi: 5x, 10x, 20x, 30x","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5iml","text":"with default parameters","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":5,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12rkm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bfk3l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"242dt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"94e3f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3flt8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"HG002 ONT SV calling default parameters","description":"","guid":"56743BF45EFA11EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"for genome in "grch37" "grch38"; do
    # Sniffles2
    sniffles2 --tandem-repeats human_${genome}.trf.bed -i hg002_ont_${genome}.bam -v sniffles2_hg002_ont_${genome}.vcf -t 8 --reference ${genome}.fasta
    # Sniffles1
    sniffles1 -m hg002_ont_${genome}.bam -v sniffles1_hg002_ont_${genome}.vcf -t 8
    # cuteSV
    cuteSV --max_cluster_bias_INS 100 --diff_ratio_merging_INS 0.3 --max_cluster_bias_DEL 100 --diff_ratio_merging_DEL 0.3 --genotype -t 8 hg002_ont_${genome}.bam ${genome}.fasta cutesv_hg002_ont_${genome}.vcf tmp
    # pbsv
    bash -c "pbsv discover -s hg2 --tandem-repeats human_${genome}.trf.bed hg002_ont_${genome}.bam pbsv.svsig.gz && pbsv call -j 8 ${genome}.fasta pbsv.svsig.gz pbsv_hg002_ont_${genome}.vcf" 
    # SVIM
    svim alignment --sequence_alleles tmp hg002_ont_${genome}.bam ${genome}.fasta && mv variants.vcf svim_hg002_ont_${genome}.vcf
done","os_name":"Linux: CentOS","os_version":"Stream 8"}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"HG002 HiFi SV calling default parameters","description":"","guid":"6B0FD1E35F0311EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"for genome in "grch37" "grch38"; do
    # Sniffles2
    sniffles2  --tandem-repeats human_${genome}.trf.bed -i hg002_hifi_${genome}.bam -v sniffles2_hg002_hifi_${genome}.vcf -t 8 --reference ${genome}.fasta
    # Sniffles1
    sniffles1  -m hg002_hifi_${genome}.bam -v sniffles1_hg002_hifi_${genome}.vcf -t 8
    # cuteSV
    cuteSV --max_cluster_bias_INS 1000 --diff_ratio_merging_INS 0.9 --max_cluster_bias_DEL 1000 --diff_ratio_merging_DEL 0.5  --genotype -t 8 hg002_hifi_${genome}.bam ${genome}.fasta cutesv_hg002_hifi_${genome}.vcf tmp
    # pbsv
    bash -c "pbsv discover -s hg2 --tandem-repeats human_${genome}.trf.bed hg002_hifi_${genome}.bam pbsv.svsig.gz && pbsv call -j 8 --ccs  ${genome}.fasta pbsv.svsig.gz pbsv_hg002_hifi_${genome}.vcf" 
    # SVIM
    svim alignment --sequence_alleles tmp hg002_hifi_${genome}.bam ${genome}.fasta && mv variants.vcf svim_hg002_hifi_${genome}.vcf
done","os_name":"Linux: CentOS","os_version":"Stream 8"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"91uvr","text":"Minimap2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q4ug","text":"MINIMAP_PRESET used are: map-ont for Oxford Nanopore and map-hifi for PacBio HiFi and map-pb for PacBio CLR","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":86,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"730pd","text":"REFERENCE is either human GRCh37 or GRCh38 with no alt/decoy chromosomes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31l42","text":"READS are fastq/compressed-fastq files","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64h6e","text":"OUT is the sample name/identification","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c22sn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b2fgi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"Long reads alignment with minimap2","description":null,"guid":"B2D2C5A65EFA11EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"minimap2 \\\n  -ax ${MINIMAP_PRESET} \\\n  -t 8  -Y --MD  \\\n  ${REFERENCE} \\\n  ${READS} | samtools sort -m 2G - \u003e ${OUT}.bam\n","os_name":"Linux: CentOS","os_version":"Stream 8"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ef1gd","text":"Sniffles low-frequency (mosaic) SV calling","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tpn9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dsq6u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"Sniffles mosaic","description":null,"guid":"A16D52DF5EF811EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"sniffles --input sample.bam --vcf sample_mosaic_sv.vcf.gz --mosaic","os_name":"","os_version":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e2gv3","text":"Optional suggested parameters","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3ut6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a57uq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"Sniffles optional suggested","description":null,"guid":"C892D33E5EF811EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"# will include the sequence of deletion
--reference reference.fasta

# will output the read names used for every SV
----output-rnames

# will use tandem repeat annotation for the reference genome. Provided for human GRCh37 and GRCh38
--tandem-repeats repeats.bed  ","os_name":"","os_version":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ijug","text":"Sniffles genotyping (force-callling) will determine the genotypes for all SVs in the given input .vcf fil","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"beqpq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7v96q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"Sniffles genotyping","description":null,"guid":"08970F7A5EF911EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"sniffles --input mapped_input.bam --vcf output.vcf.gz --snf output.snf --genotype-vcf known_sv.vcf.gz","os_name":"","os_version":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9p5jv","text":"LRA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1iu7l","text":"READS are gzip-compressed-fastq files","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6r7ff","text":"LRA_PRESET used are: -ONT for Oxford Nanopore and -CCS for PacBio HiFi and -CLRfor PacBio CLR","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":21,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":75,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ablmf","text":"REFERENCE is either human GRCh37 or GRCh38 with no alt/decoy chromosomes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4uqg","text":"OUTFORMAT is s for SAM ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":13,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nhhb","text":"OUT is the sample name/identification","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"269f7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c6qu6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"Long read alignment with LRA","description":null,"guid":"D8809EF85EFD11EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"gzip-cd ${READS} | lra align ${LRA_PRESET} -t 8 -p ${OUTFORMAT} --noMismatch ${REFERENCE} /dev/stdin | samtools view -hb - | samtools sort - \u003e ${OUT}.bam\"","os_name":"Linux: CentOS","os_version":"Stream 8"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vc91","text":"HG002 SV calling for the following technologies and coverage:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ed33","text":"Oxford Nanopore Technologies: 5x, 10x, 20x, 30x and 50x","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64lme","text":"PacBio HiFi: 5x, 10x, 20x, 30x","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fe9f9","text":"with sensitive parameters","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":5,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chbdp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1lloc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1cll","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5j7h1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"HG002 ONT SV calling sensitive parameters","description":null,"guid":"3C0FA2B75F0311EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"for genome in "grch37" "grch38"; do
    # Sniffles1
    sniffles1 -s 2 -m hg002_ont_${genome}.bam -v sniffles1_hg002_ont_${genome}.vcf -t 8
    # cuteSV
    cuteSV --max_cluster_bias_INS 100 --diff_ratio_merging_INS 0.3 --max_cluster_bias_DEL 100 --diff_ratio_merging_DEL 0.3 -s 2 --genotype -t 8 hg002_ont_${genome}.bam ${genome}.fasta cutesv_hg002_ont_${genome}.vcf tmp
    # pbsv
    bash -c "pbsv discover -s hg2 --tandem-repeats human_${genome}.trf.bed hg002_ont_${genome}.bam pbsv.svsig.gz && pbsv call -j 8  -A 2 ${genome}.fasta pbsv.svsig.gz pbsv_hg002_ont_${genome}.vcf" 
    # SVIM
    svim alignment --sequence_alleles tmp hg002_ont_${genome}.bam ${genome}.fasta && mv variants.vcf svim_hg002_ont_${genome}.vcf
done","os_name":"Linux: CentOS","os_version":"Stream 8"}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"HG002 HiFi SV calling sensitive parameters","description":null,"guid":"B276D2725F0311EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"for genome in "grch37" "grch38"; do
    # Sniffles1
    sniffles1 -s 2 -m hg002_hifi_${genome}.bam -v sniffles1_hg002_hifi_${genome}.vcf -t 8
    # cuteSV
    cuteSV --max_cluster_bias_INS 1000 --diff_ratio_merging_INS 0.9 --max_cluster_bias_DEL 1000 --diff_ratio_merging_DEL 0.5 -s 2 --genotype -t 8 hg002_hifi_${genome}.bam ${genome}.fasta cutesv_hg002_hifi_${genome}.vcf tmp
    # pbsv
    bash -c "pbsv discover -s hg2 --tandem-repeats human_${genome}.trf.bed hg002_hifi_${genome}.bam pbsv.svsig.gz && pbsv call -j 8 --ccs -A 2 ${genome}.fasta pbsv.svsig.gz pbsv_hg002_hifi_${genome}.vcf" 
    # SVIM
    svim alignment --sequence_alleles tmp hg002_hifi_${genome}.bam ${genome}.fasta && mv variants.vcf _hg002_hifi_${genome}.vcf
done","os_name":"Linux: CentOS","os_version":"Stream 8 "}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgjgr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehs2o","text":"SV benchmark comparison to Genome in a Bottle SV dataset v0.6 using truvari 2.1 following the GIAB recommended parameters","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djn26","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"du7h3","text":"SV benchmark comparison to Genome in a Bottle SV Challenging Medical Relevant Genes (CMRG) v0.1 using truvari 2.1 following the GIAB recommended parameters","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97cv5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"86mu1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"GRCh37 / GIAB v0.6 SV benchmark (Truvari bench)","description":null,"guid":"ED8316755F0111EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"for longreads in "ont" "hifi"; do
    truvari bench -b HG002_SVs_Tier1_v0.6.vcf.gz -c hg002_${longreads}_grch37.vcf.gz -o truvari_bench_${longreads} -f grch37.fasta --includebed HG002_SVs_Tier1_v0.6.bed --passonly --giabreport
done","os_name":"Linux: CentOS","os_version":"Stream 8"}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"GRCh38 / Challenging Medical Relevant Genes (CMRG) benchmark (Truvari bench)","description":null,"guid":"1F5EB10E5F0411EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"for longreads in "ont" "hifi"; do
    truvari bench -b HG002_CMRG_v0.01.vcf.gz -c hg002_${longreads}_grch38.vcf.gz -o truvari_bench -f grch38.fa --includebed HG002_GRCh38_CRMG_v0.01.bed --passonly
done","os_name":"Linux: CentOS","os_version":"Stream 8"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"farf5","text":"SV calling with Sniffles2 and cuteSV","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g4g0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmsm1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fb324","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"Low-frequency SV calling benchmark","description":"","guid":"E7842A265F0511EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"# Sniffles2 mosaic
sniffles2 --tandem-repeats human_hs37d5.trf.bed -i hg002_hg00733.bam -t 8 --reference grch37.fasta -v sniffles2_hg002_hg00733_mosaic.vcf --mosaic

# Sniffles2 germline (default)
sniffles2 --tandem-repeats human_hs37d5.trf.bed -i hg002_hg00733.bam -t 8 --reference grch37.fasta -v sniffles2_hg002_hg00733_germline.vcf

# cuteSV
cuteSV --max_cluster_bias_INS 100 --diff_ratio_merging_INS 0.3 --max_cluster_bias_DEL 100 --diff_ratio_merging_DEL 0.3 --genotype -t 8 hg002_hg00733.bam  grch37.fasta  cute_SV_hg002_hg00733.vcf tmp","os_name":"Linux: CentOS","os_version":"Stream 8"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5qdcg","text":"SV benchmark","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7456m","text":"We then used the SV from the GIAB v0.6 benchmark (see step 11) and compared the three call sets: Sniffles germline, Sniffles mosaic and cuteSV. For Sniffles mosaic we also filtered GIAB v0.6 benchmark based on the variant allele frequency (VAF) range that Sniffles2 mosaic mode uses (VAF 5%-20%) to compute the adjusted recall.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fegvf","text":"HG002 reads: https://labs.epi2me.io/gm24385_q20_2021.10/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":43}],"data":{}},{"key":"ed83t","text":"HG003 reads: https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/ReferenceSamples/giab/data/AshkenazimTrio/HG003_NA24149_father/UCSC_Ultralong_OxfordNanopore_Promethion/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":13,"length":133}],"data":{}},{"key":"3ur0k","text":"HG003 reads: https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/ReferenceSamples/giab/data/AshkenazimTrio/HG004_NA24143_mother/UCSC_Ultralong_OxfordNanopore_Promethion/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":13,"length":133}],"data":{}},{"key":"8o9ft","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A12A16005F0611EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://labs.epi2me.io/gm24385_q20_2021.10"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B45C017E5F0611EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/ReferenceSamples/giab/data/AshkenazimTrio/HG003_NA24149_father/UCSC_Ultralong_OxfordNanopore_Promethion"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B8284C6F5F0611EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/ReferenceSamples/giab/data/AshkenazimTrio/HG004_NA24143_mother/UCSC_Ultralong_OxfordNanopore_Promethion"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eogev","text":"Read alignment was don as in step 7","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":29,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"92lfk","text":"Sniffles2 SV calling was done as in step 3 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97cp6","text":"cuteSV SV calling was done as in step 10 for Oxford Nanopore data for each sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vm4e","text":"Next SURVIVOR was used to merge the SV calls from the three samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"291hd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c96mt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"SURVIVOR merge","description":"","guid":"5F35422D5F0711EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"ls cutesv_hg002_grch37.vcf cutesv_hg003_grch37.vcf cutesv_hg004_grch37.vcf \u003e trio_samples.list\nsurvivor merge trio_samples.list 1000 1 1 0 0 50 cuteSV_trio_grch37.vcf\n","os_name":"Linux: CentOS","os_version":"Stream 8"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5cpo1","text":"Mendelian consistency test with bcftools's mendelian plugin with the three output files: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dk49u","text":"Sniffles2 population merge (step 18), cuteSV (step 19) and cuteSV force-called (step 20)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":46,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":80,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6jv5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7duqv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"bcftools mendelian consistency","description":"","guid":"041575395F0811EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"# Sniffles2 population
bcftools +mendelian sniffles2_trio_grch37.vcf.gz -t hg004,hg003,hg002

# cuteSV vanilla
bcftools +mendelian cuteSV_trio_grch37.vcf -t hg004,hg003,hg002

# cuteSV force-called
bcftools +mendelian cuteSV_trio_grch37_force.vcf -t hg004,hg003,hg002","os_name":"Linux: CentOS","os_version":"Stream 8"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"55sa8","text":"An additional step was performed for cuteSV which consists in genotyping/force-calling the SV from the merged VCF, to then merge again with SURVIVOR ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ai56b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f9ota","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"cuteSV force-call and merge","description":null,"guid":"960770B55F0711EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"# Calling
for sample_id in "hg002" "hg003" "hg004"; do
    cuteSV --max_cluster_bias_INS 100 --diff_ratio_merging_INS 0.3 --max_cluster_bias_DEL 100 --diff_ratio_merging_DEL 0.3 -s 2 --genotype -t 8 ${sample_id}_grch37.bam grch37.fasta cutesv_${sample_id}_grch37_force.vcf tmp -Ivcf cuteSV_trio_grch37.vcf
done

# Merge
ls cutesv_hg002_grch37_force.vcf cutesv_hg003_grch37_force.vcf cutesv_hg004_grch37_force.vcf > trio_samples_force.list
survivor merge trio_samples_force.list 1000 1 1 0 0 50 cuteSV_trio_grch37_force.vcf","os_name":"Linux: CentOS","os_version":"Stream 8"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6bd11","text":"We called all samples as in step 3 (Sniffles2 population SV calling) and subsequently merged them (step 3). We used the resulting fully-genotyped population VCF file of the rest of the analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":99,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amqm1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kvon","text":"Next, we filtered out SV if they were in either of the following categories:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pqal","text":"SV \u003c 10kb","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jmg8","text":"SV present in either a mother or father based on the sample identification and SUPP_VEC (see below)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bchko","text":"SV in an autosome","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7q96h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2irt","text":"We ended up with SV that were only present in the probands and that were likely causative of the observed phenotype.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88cqo","text":"Filtering was done with bcftools view and a custom python script \"sniffles2_vcf_parser.py\"found in  https://github.com/smolkmo/Sniffles2-Supplement and https://zenodo.org/record/8122060","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":66,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":100,"length":47},{"key":1,"offset":152,"length":33}],"data":{}},{"key":"4t59h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9i2go","text":"The SUPP_VEC is a field in the INFO section of the VCF file that denotes the presence/absence of a genetic variant (in our case Structural Variant, SV) in the sample for the sample position/index","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5toql","text":"For samples A B and C, the SUPP_VEC=101 means that the genetic variant is present in samples A and C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5625CC285F0911EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/smolkmo/Sniffles2-Supplement"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3F4015C55F0911EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://zenodo.org/record/8122060"}}}}

title: Sniffles2 methods
